result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianne L Sandoval was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Brianne L Sandoval (by video conferencing) with Attorney Rebecca Rhoda Fisher appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:03)
Fisher - here today to do plea on Ct 1 - 60 day concurrent to MN sentence with credit 34 days, $268 cc, $250 dna surchg, rest
State - plea to forgery - need to waive prelim - don't have Information
Fisher - haven't talked to deft about waiver
(11:06) will step off bench so atty can talk to deft - DA to prepare Information
(11:14) back on record
Court questions deft 
Deft - waives prelim hearing
State files Information
Deft pleads guilty - waives rights & JT
State - argues sentence
Fisher - argues sent - already has time served for this matter - eligible for boot camp
Deft - okay with having hearing by video conferencing

COURT:  waiver of prelim voluntary - finds probable cause for bind over
plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg
$  10 drug surchg
***60 DAYS TO PAY***
60 days jail concurrent to current sentence in MN
Credit 34 days
no restitution
victims rights complied with
cannot possess firearm
cannot vote
email on having deft for video conferencing

(1:35)
Deft is in custody and testifying - have agreement - will be going to Minnesota

COURT:  try to set this week before she's returned to MN
bond continues
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 11:45 am.

to appear by phone

COURT:  could do misdemeanor over phone, counsel to check out if video conferencing is available for deft

from new attorney to reschedule
